a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of primary energy that is low-carbon vs. GDP per capita, 2023

Low-carbon energy is the sum of nuclear and renewable sources, and is measured as a percentage of
primary

energy
consumption using the
substitution method
. Gross domestic product (GDP) per capita is adjusted for
inflation and differences in living costs between countries.
Share of energy from low-carbon sources
Data source: Energy Institute - Statistical Review of World Energy (2024); Eurostat, OECD, and World Bank (2025)

Note: GDP data is expressed in
international-$
at 2021 prices.
